src_text: Issues in the Environment.
tgt_text: Ditaba tša Tikologo.

src_text: Energy.
tgt_text: Enetši.

src_text: Cabinet noted the progress made in the implementation of the Energy Action Plan, while it acknowledges significant constraints that still remain against the national grid..
tgt_text: Kabinete lemogile kgatelopele ye dirilwego mo phethagatšong ya Leanotiro la Enetši, mola amogela mathata magolo ao sa ntšego le gona kgahlanong le keriti ya bosetšhaba..

src_text: As the country enters the Winter period, Cabinet welcomed the finalisation of the Contract for 400 megawatts (MW) of additional capacity through the Standard Offer Programme which will be online before the end of May.
tgt_text: Ge naga tsena sehleng sa Marega, Kabinete amogetše go phethwa ga Konteraka ya 400 megawatts (MW) ya mohlagase wa tlaleletšo ka Lenaneo la Kabo ya Tlwaelo leo le tla tsentšhwago mošomong pele ga mafelelo Mopitlo.

src_text: Furthermore, the Department of Health has identified 213 hospitals for exclusion from load-shedding, with 76 of these already excluded and work to add another 46 hospitals at an advanced stage..
tgt_text: Go feta fao, Kgoro ya Maphelo hlaotše dipetlele tše 213 gore di se akaretswe go kgaotšo ya mohlagase, tše 76 tša tšona di šetše di sa akaretšwe gomme mošomo wa go oketša dipetlele tše dingwe tše 46 gatetše pele..

src_text: Cabinet further welcomed the imminent launch of the Energy One-Stop Shop on 31 May 2023 by Invest SA to speed up the regulatory processes that will assist new power-generating companies to come on board..
tgt_text: Kabinete tšwetše pele go amogela thakgolo ye lego kgauswi ya Lebenkele la Kakaretšo la Enetši ka la 31 Mopitlo 2023 ke Invest SA go akgofiša ditshepetšo tša taolo tšeo di tlago thuša dikhamphani tše mpsha tša go tšweletša mohlagase gore di akaretšwe..

src_text: It has noted progress made at the Kusile Power Station to restore 3 200 MW, through units 1, 2, 3 and 5, to the national grid by the end of..
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše kgatelopele ye dirilwego ka Seteišeneng sa Mohlagase sa Kusile ya go bušetša 3 200 MW, ka yuniting ya 1, 2, 3 le ya 5, go keriti ya bosetšhaba mafelelong .

src_text: Cabinet is concerned about the continued circulation of fake news, through social media alleging an imminent national grid collapse that will result in total blackout.
tgt_text: Kabinete tshwenywa ke phatlalatšo ya ditaba tša maaka ye tšwelago pele, ka bobegaditaba bja leago bjo bo latofatša go phuhlama ga keriti ya bosetšhaba wo lego kgauswi woo tlago feleletša ka kgaotšo ya mohlagase ka botlalo.

src_text: Eskom has assured government of plans in place for the system safeguards to prevent national blackout.
tgt_text: Eskom netefaleditše mmušo ka maano ao lego gona ditšhireletšo tša sestemo go thibela kgaotšo ya mohlagase ya bosetšhaba.

src_text: Cabinet reiterates calls to all people in South Africa to continue to save electricity.
tgt_text: Kabinete bušeletša boipiletšo go batho ka moka ka Afrika Borwa go tšwela pele go boloka mohlagase.

src_text: The target is to save at least 1 000 MW everyday, which equals saving one stage of load-shedding each day.
tgt_text: Nepo ke go boloka bonnyane 1 000 MW letšatši le letšatši, yeo lekanago le go boloka kgato tee ya kgaotšo ya mohlagase letšatši le lengwe le le lengwe.

src_text: The Minister of Electricity, Dr Kgosientsho Ramokgopa, will update the country on the implementation of the Energy Action Plan on Friday, 26 May 2023, through media briefing.
tgt_text: Tona ya Mohlagase, Ngaka Kgosientsho Ramokgopa tla begela setšhaba tshedimošo ya bjalebjale ka ga phethagatšo ya Leanotiro la Enetši ka Labohlano, la 26 Mopitlo 2023, ka kopano ya boraditaba.

src_text: Health.
tgt_text: Maphelo.

src_text: Government has established technical working committee, led by the National Department of Health, in response of the outbreak of cholera in Hammanskraal in the City of Tshwane, which has already claimed 15 lives as of 24 May..
tgt_text: Mmušo hlomile komiti ya mošomo ya setegeniki, yeo etilwego pele ke Kgoro ya Bosetšhaba ya Maphelo, go araba go phulega ga kholera go la Hammanskraal ka Toropongkgolo ya Tshwane, yeo šetšego tšere maphelo 15 go fihla ka la 24 Mopitlo..

src_text: Extensive work is underway to test all possible sources of the contamination, be they water sources, tankers delivering water, taps and the Rooiwal Wastewater Treatment Works (WWTW).
tgt_text: Mošomo wo mogolo tšwela pele go dira diteko tsa methopo ka moka ye kgonegago ya tšhilafatšo ka ba methopo ya meetse, ditanka tša go sepetša meetse, dipompi le Lenaneo la Tlhwekišo ya Meetse Ditšhila la Rooiwal (WWTW).

src_text: To date, no evidence of cholera bacteria has been found in these sources, giving confidence to the likelihood that the cholera outbreak could be from once-off contamination event, with the current cases being result of secondary and tertiary contamination.
tgt_text: Go fihla ga bjale, ga go na bohlatse bja ditwatši tša kholera bjo bo hweditšwego methopong ye, se se fa tshepo ya gore go nale kgonagalo ya gore go phulega ga kholera go ka ba go tšwa tiragalong ya tšhilafatšo yeo diregago gatee nakong ya go feta gomme ditiragalo tša bjale ke ditlamorago tša go fetetšana ka bolwetši gomme le bao ba feteditšwego le bona ba fetetša ba bangwe.

src_text: As these interventions unfold, residents of Hammanskraal are encouraged to boil tap water and add pinch of salt before drinking it.
tgt_text: Ge magato a tšwelapele, badudi ba Hammanskraal ba hlohleletšwa gore ba bediše meetse dipompi le go tšhela letswatšana pele ba nwa.

src_text: In addition, anyone with runny tummy, nausea or gastrointestinal symptoms must immediately visit their doctor or local clinic.
tgt_text: Go tlaleletša, mang le mang yo nago le letšhollo, go sellega goba dika tša go longwa ke mala swanetše go ya ngakeng ya gagwe goba kliniking ya tikologo ka pela.

src_text: The Minister of Water and Sanitation, Mr Senzo Mchunu, will meet with the City of Tshwane Mayor, Cllr Cilliers Brink, on Friday 26 May 2023 in an effort to develop joint plan for the long overdue refurbishment of the Rooiwal WWTW..
tgt_text: Tona ya Meetse le Kelelatšhila, Morena Senzo Mchunu tla kopana le Meyara wa Toropokgolo ya Tshwane, Mokhanselara Cilliers Brink, ka Labohlano la di 26 Mopitlo 2023 ka maiteko go tšweletša leano la mohlakanelwa la tsošološo ya WWTW ya Rooiwal yeo šaletšego morago..

src_text: For more information you can call the 24-hour hotline of the National Institute for Communicable Diseases (NICD) on 082 883.
tgt_text: Go hwetša tshedimošo ka botlalo ka leletša mogala wo šomago bošego le mosegare wa Setheo sa Bosetšhaba sa Malwetši Fetelago (NICD) go 082 883.

src_text: Cholera treatment guidelines are online at www.nicd.ac.za.
tgt_text: Melawana ya kalafo ya kholera ka hwetšwa inthaneteng go www.nicd.ac.za.

src_text: Quarterly Labour Force Survey (QLFS).
tgt_text: Dinyakišišo tša Kotara ya Bašomi (QLFS).

src_text: Cabinet is encouraged that the 2023 first QLFS has indicated sixth consecutive quarterly increase on the number of jobs and that the employment of.
tgt_text: Kabinete hlohleletšwa ke gore QLFS ya mathomo ya 2023 laeditše koketšego ya botshelela ka go latelana ya kotara ya palo ya mešomo le gore mešomo ya batho ba.

src_text: 2 million people is inching closer to the.
tgt_text: 2 milione batamela kgauswi le batho ba.

src_text: 4 million employed people in pre-Coronavirus (COVID)-19 days.
tgt_text: 4 milione bao ba thwetšwego ka matšatšing pele ga Coronavirus (COVID-19).

src_text: This is clear indication that the South African economy is firmly recovering from the impact of that pandemic..
tgt_text: Se ke sešupo se se kwagalago sa gore ikonomi ya Afrika Borwa kaonafala go tšwa go khuetšo ya leuba leo..

src_text: The first quarter employment figures show 209 000 jobs were created in the formal sector and 107 000 jobs in the informal sector during the first quarter of the year.
tgt_text: Dipalopalo tša mešomo ya kotara ya mathomo di laetša gore mešomo ye 209 000 hlotšwe ka lekaleng la semmušo gomme mešomo ye 107 000 ka lekaleng leo sego la semmušo mo kotareng ya mathomo ya ngwaga.

src_text: South Africa – United States (US) relations.
tgt_text: Dikamano tša Afrika Borwa le United States (US).

src_text: Cabinet affirmed that relations between South Africa and the US remain cordial, strong and mutually beneficial following meeting between the Minister of International Relations and Cooperation, Dr Naledi Pandor and US Ambassador to South Africa, Mr Reuben Brigety, over his remarks alleging that South Africa supplied weapons to Russia.
tgt_text: Kabinete netefaditše gore dikamano gare ga Afrika Borwa le US ke ye botse tiile ebile hola dinaga ka bobedi morago ga kopano gare ga Tona ya Dikamano tša Boditšhabatšhaba le Tirišano, Ngaka Naledi Pandor le Motseta wa Amerika ka Afrika Borwa, Morena Reuben Brigety, ka ga dipolelo tša gagwe tša go latofatša gore Borwa Afrika abetše Russia dibetša.

src_text: Cabinet reiterated that established diplomatic channels are available to all nations, including the US, to raise issues as they arise in the management of the bilateral relations.
tgt_text: Kabinete boeleditše gore dikanale tša botseta tše di tiiletšeng di hwetšagala ditšhabeng ka moka, go akaretšwa US, go hlagiša ditaba ge di tšwelela ka taolong ya dikamano tša dinagamaloko tše pedi.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the announcement by President Cyril Ramaphosa of the establishment of an independent inquiry to probe the allegations of the supply of weapons from South Africa to Russia.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše tsebišo ya Mopresidente Cyril Ramaphosa ya go hlongwa ga nyakišišo ye ikemetšego go nyakišiša ditatofatšo tša kabo ya dibetša go tšwa Afrika Borwa go ya Russia.

src_text: Details of the inquiry will be announced in due course.
tgt_text: Dintlha ka botlalo tša nyakišišo di tla tsebagatšwa ka nako ye swanetšego.

src_text: South Africa – Singapore relations.
tgt_text: Dikamano tša Afrika Borwa le Singapore.

src_text: President Ramaphosa hosted Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong of the Republic of Singapore on Tuesday, 16 May..
tgt_text: Mopresidente Ramaphosa amogetše Tonakgolo Lee Hsien Loong wa Repabliki ya Singapore ka Labobedi, la 16 Mopitlo..

src_text: Singapore is significant investor in South Africa, with investments totalling over R5 billion in sectors such as manufacturing, financial services and real estate.
tgt_text: Singapore ke mmeeletši yo bohlokwa ka Afrika Borwa, ka dipeeletšo tša palomoka ya go feta R5 pilione ka makaleng go swana le tšweletšo, ditirelo tša ditšhelete le thekišo ya dithoto.

src_text: Signed agreements between the two countries aim to strengthen trade, investment, education and defence cooperation..
tgt_text: Ditumelelano tše di saennwego gare ga dinaga tše pedi di ikemišeditše go matlafatša kgwebišano, peeletšo, tšhomišano ya thuto le tšhireletšo..

src_text: Western Cape District Development Model (DDM) Presidential Imbizo.
tgt_text: Imbizo ya Mopresidente ya Mmotlolo wa Tlhabollo ya Selete sa Kapa Bodikela (DDM).

src_text: President Ramaphosa undertook the sixth DDM Presidential Imbizo to the Western Cape, Drakenstein Local Municipality, Cape Winelands District, on Friday, 19 May..
tgt_text: Mopresidente Ramaphosa swere Imbizo ya Mopresidente ya botshelela ya DDM go la Kapa Bodikela, Mmasepaleng wa Selegae wa Drakenstein, Seleteng sa Cape Winelands, ka Labohlano, la 19 Mopitlo..

src_text: The President led delegation from all three spheres of government under the theme: “Leave No One behind”.
tgt_text: Mopresidente etile pele kemedi go tšwa maemong ka moka mararo mmušo ka fase ga kgwekgwe ye: “Se tlogele motho morago”.

src_text: The Imbizo was preceded by the President’s visit to the nearby Vlakkeland Catalytic Human Settlement Development, which is the largest public housing development to date in the Drakenstein Local Municipality.
tgt_text: Imbizo etilwe pele ke ketelo ya Mopresidente go Tlhabollo ya Bodulo bja Batho Bjo bo Kopanyago bja Vlakkeland ya kgauswi, yeo lego tlhabollo ye kgolo ya dintlo tša setšhaba go fihla ga bjale ka Mmasepaleng wa Selegae wa Drakenstein.

src_text: The development that commenced in 2017 will upon completion provide 2 556 houses to qualifying beneficiaries.
tgt_text: Tlhabollo yeo thomilego ka 2017 ge phethilwe tla fa baholegi ba ba kgotsofatšago dinyakwa dintlo tše.

src_text: The construction of 942 houses in the First Phase is underway, with 454 completed and 301 under construction.
tgt_text: Kago ya dintlo tše 942 mo Kgatong ya Pele a tšwela pele, dintlo tše 454 di phethilwe gomme tše 301 di sa agwa.

src_text: The importance of this project is that it caters for variety of housing options from those with an income of R0 to R3 500 (under Breaking New Ground), to Finance Linked Individual Subsidy Programme, for those earning between R3,501 and R22 000 per annum.
tgt_text: Bohlokwa bja protšeke ye ke gore hlokomela dikgetho tša dintlo tša go fapafapana go tloga go bao ba nago le letseno la R0 go ya go R3 500 (ka fase ga Breaking New Ground), go fihla go Lenaneo la Thušo ya Motho ka Noši leo le Kgokagantšwego ka Tšhelete, go bao ba hwetšago mogolo wa gare ga R3 501 le R22 000 ka ngwaga.

src_text: Both Social Housing opportunities as well as opportunities for Military Veterans are available in this project.
tgt_text: Bobedi menyetla ya Dintlo tša Leago gammogo le menyetla ya Bagale ba Sešole di gona ka gare ga protšeke ye.

src_text: Oversight Visit to eThekwini Metropolitan Municipality and uMgungundlovu District Municipality on 18 and 19 May.
tgt_text: Ketelo ya Tlhokomedišo go Mmasepala wa Metropholithene wa eThekwini le Mmasepala wa Selete wa uMgungundlovu ka la 18 le la 19 Mopitlo.

src_text: Deputy President Paul Mashatile engaged stakeholders in education and training, agriculture, commerce and industry during an oversight visit to the eThekwini Metropolitan Municipality and uMgungundlovu District Municipality as part of the DDM oversight visits.
tgt_text: Motlatšamopresidente Paul Mashatile boledišane le bakgathatema thutong le tlhahlong, temong, kgwebong le intastering nakong ya ketelo ya tlhokomedišo go Mmasepala wa Metropholithene wa eThekwini le Mmasepala wa Selete wa uMgungundlovu bjalo ka karolo ya diketelo tša tlhokomelo ya DDM nngwe ya diprotšeke tše bohlokwa tšeo di etetšwego bile lefelo la Protšeke ya Catalytic ya Ntshongweni, moo go agwago Smart City gare ga Durban le Pietermaritzburg.

src_text: One of the key projects visited was the Ntshongweni Catalytic Project site, where Smart City is being constructed between Durban and Pietermaritzburg.
tgt_text: Protšeke ye tla tsošološa ikonomi ka lefelong leo, go ba le seabe go dipeeletšo tša boleng bja R15 pilione mo mengwageng ye 10 go ya go ye 15 ye tlago.

src_text: The project will revitalise economic activity in the area, contributing about R15 billion worth of investments in the next 10 to 15 years.
tgt_text: Mananeokgoparara Meetse.

src_text: Water infrastructure.
tgt_text: Mopresidente Ramaphosa etetše Protšeke ya Meetse ya Dinagagodimo tša Lesotho ka Labobedi, 23 Mopitlo 2023 yeo tšerego karolo moletlong wa yona wa go ribolla lekwate wa Kgato ya 2 ya protšeke.

src_text: President Ramaphosa visited the Lesotho Highlands Water Project on Tuesday, 23 May 2023 during which he participated in the sod-turning ceremony of Phase 2 of the project.
tgt_text: Bjalo ka ge saenetšwe mengwaga ye mmalwa ye fetilego le go diegišwa, moletlo wo laeditše tšwelopele ya maitapišo a bohlokwa dinaga tše pedi.

src_text: Signed number of years back and having faced delays, this ceremony signified the pacing up of this critical binational initiative.
tgt_text: Protšeke ya Meetse ya dinagagodimo tsa Lesotho bohlokwa kudu mo go kgonthišeng polokego ya kabo ya meetse ka Gauteng, Freistata, Mpumalanga, Leboa Bodikela le Kapa Leboa.

src_text: The Lesotho Highlands Water Project is critical in ensuring security of water supply in Gauteng, the Free State, Mpumalanga, North West and Northern Cape.
tgt_text: Peeletšo ya mananeokgoparara meetse go kaonafatša maphelo Maafrika Borwa tšwela pele ka kabo ya go feta R14 pilione go mebasepala go rarolla tshalelonthago ya kabo ya maneokgoparara meetse, ka Thušo ya Mananeokgoparara Magolo Selete (RBIG) le Thušo ya Mananeokgoparara Ditirelo tša Meetse (WSIG).

src_text: The investment in water infrastructure to uplift the lives of South Africans continues with the allocation of over R14 billion to municipalities to address water infrastructure backlogs, through the Regional Bulk Infrastructure Grant (RBIG) and the Water Services Infrastructure Grant (WSIG).
tgt_text: RBIG tla šomišwa go diprotšeke tše 130 gomme WSIG tla abelwa diprotšeke tša go feta 400 nageng ka bophara.

src_text: The RBIG will be spent on 130 projects and the WSIG will be allocated to over 400 projects across the country.
tgt_text: Gape kabinete kgotsofaditšwe ke gore Kgoro ya Meetse le Kelelatšhila (DWS) gatela pele mo twantšhong ya bomenetša ka go lefelwa ga tšhelete ye nyakileng go ba R600 milione ke dikhamphani tšeo di holegilego go tšwa kamogelong ya dithendara tša go se sepetšwe ka tshwanelo.

src_text: Cabinet is also pleased that the Department of Water and Sanitation (DWS) is making strides in the fight against corruption with nearly R600 million repaid by companies who benefited from receiving irregular tenders.
tgt_text: Kabinete lemogile gape magato taolo ya thibelo ao beilwego ke kgoro go fediša ditshenyegelo tše di sa sepetswego ka tshwanelo, tša tshenyo.

src_text: Cabinet also noted the preventative control measures put in place by the department to eliminate irregular, fruitless and wasteful expenditure.
tgt_text: Sefoka sa Tšhireletšo ya Leago.

src_text: Social Security Award.
tgt_text: Afrika Borwa amogetše Sefoka sa Mekgwa ye Mebotse ya Mokgatlo wa Boditšhabatšhaba wa Tšhireletšo ya Leago (ISSA) ka go Tšhireletšo ya Leago ya Afrika 2023, seo se amogelago peeletšo ya mmušo maphelong bana ba rena, kudu bao ba tšwago malapeng bohloki le ao lego kotsing.

src_text: South Africa has received the prestigious International Social Security Association (ISSA) Good Practice Award in Social Security for Africa 2023, which recognises government’s investment in the lives of our children, especially those from poor and vulnerable households.
tgt_text: Kgopelo ya Afrika Borwa sefokeng se sa maemo godimo be bitšwa: “Katološo ya kakaretšo ya tšhireletšo ya leago ka go nanya go bana bao ba lego kotsing: Taba ya Thušo ya Thekgo ya Bana, Afrika Borwa”.

src_text: South Africa’s entry to this prestigious award was titled: “Gradual extension of social security coverage to vulnerable children: The case of the Child Support Grant, South Africa” total of 138 entries were received from 48 member institutions in over 30 countries in Africa.
tgt_text: Palomoka ya dikgopelo tše 138 di amogetšwe go tšwa go ditheo tše 48 tša maloko dinageng tša go feta tše 30 ka Afrika.

src_text: Our social assistance is at the heart of government’s poverty alleviation programme and central to restoring the dignity of our people.
tgt_text: Thušo ya rena ya leago ke lenaneo la bohlokwa la mmušo la phokotšo ya bohloki ebile le bohlokwa pušetšong ya seriti go batho ba gabo rena.

src_text: South Africa’s social protection system is amongst the largest in the world, with more than 18 million beneficiaries..
tgt_text: Mokgwa wa tšhireletšo ya leago wa Afrika Borwa magareng ga mangwe magologolo lefaseng, ka bathušegi ba go feta 18 milione..

src_text: Budget Votes.
tgt_text: Dibouto tša Tekanyetšo.

src_text: Cabinet is pleased that Budget Votes by government departments are progressing well.
tgt_text: Kabinete kgotsofatšwa ke gore Dibouto tša Tekanyetšo ka dikgoro tša mmušo di tšwela pele gabotse.

src_text: The schedule of upcoming Budget Votes and supporting media briefings:..
tgt_text: Ka fase ke Lenaneo la Dibouto tša Tekanyetšo tše di tlago le dikopano tša boraditaba tša thekgo:..

src_text: Friday 26 May 2023 at 13:00, the Minister of Cooperative Governance and Traditional Affairs (CoGTA), Ms Thembi Nkadimeng, will conduct media briefing on the CoGTA Budget Vote which will outline measures aimed at strengthening the performance of municipalities.
tgt_text: Labohlano la 26 Mopitlo 2023 ka 13:00, Tona ya Pušotirišano le Merero ya Setšo (CoGTA), Mohumagadi Thembi Nkadimeng tla swara kopano ya boraditaba ka ga Bouto ya Tekanyetšo ya CoGTA yeo tlago hlaloša magato ao lebanego le go matlafatša tshepedišo ya mebasepala...

Ka Labobedi, la 30 Mopitlo 2023, Tona ya Tlhabollo ya Leago, Mohumagadi Lindiwe Zulu, le Tona ya Toka le Ditirelo tša Tshokollo, Morena Ronald Lamola, ba tla swara Dibouto tša bona tša Tekanyetšo gomme dintlha tša dikopano tša bona tša boraditaba di tla abelanwa mo sebakeng sa go se fetše pelo..

src_text: On Tuesday, 30 May 2023, the Minister of Social Development, Ms Lindiwe Zulu, and the Minister of Justice and Correctional Services, Mr Ronald Lamola, will hold their Budget Votes and details of their media briefings will be shared in due course..
tgt_text: Bouto ya Tekanyetšo ya Mopresidente tla alwa ka Laboraro, la 31 Mopitlo 2023 gomme kopano ya boraditaba ka ga Kgatelopele ka Dipeakanyoleswa tša Sebopego le Maitapišo Mešomo ao rulagantšwego ka lenaneo la Operation Vulindlela tla swarwa ka Labobedi, la 30 Mopitlo.

src_text: The Presidency’s Budget Vote will be tabled on Wednesday, 31 May 2023 and the media briefing on Progress with Structural Reforms and the Employment Initiatives coordinated through Operation Vulindlela will be held on Tuesday, 30 May.
tgt_text: Letšatši la Afrika le Segopotšo sa Mengwaga ye 20 ya Mokgwa wa Tekolo ya Sethaka wa Afrika (APRM).

src_text: Africa Day and the African Peer Review Mechanism (APRM) 20 year anniversary.
tgt_text: Kabinete le Maafrika Borwa ka moka ba kopana le kontinente ya Afrika le lefase ka bophara go keteka Letšatši la Afrika ka Labone, la 25 Mopitlo.

src_text: Cabinet and all South Africans join the African continent and the globe in celebrating Africa Day on Thursday, 25 May.
tgt_text: Ngwaga wo bohlokwa kudu ka ge re keteka segopotšo sa bo60 sa go saenwa ga tšhatha ya go hlongwa ga Mokgatlo wa Botee bja Afrika lego makgoraditsela Kopano ya Afrika.

src_text: This year is particularly important as it marks the 60th anniversary of the signing of the founding charter of the Organisation of African Unity, the forerunner to the African Union.
tgt_text: Morero wa meketeko ya 2023 – “Go akgofiša phethagatšo ya Lefelo la Kgwebišano ya go Hloka Ditšhitišo Magareng ga Dinaga tša Kontinente ya Afrika” – amogela dikgato tše di dirwago ka go tliša tirišong ya lefelo le legolo la kgwebišano ya go hloka ditšhitišo.

src_text: The theme for the 2023 celebrations – “Acceleration of the African Continental Free Trade Area implementation” – acknowledges the strides being made in bringing into operation of the world’s largest free trade area.
tgt_text: Segopotšo sa Kgwedi ya Afrika sa ngwaga wo se sepelelana le segopotšo sa bo20 sa APRM, yeo ikemišeditšego go godiša pušo ye botse ka khontinenteng ka thuto ya mphato ye rulagantšwego le go itekola

src_text: This year’s Africa Month commemoration coincides with the 20th anniversary of the APRM, which is aimed at fostering good governance in the continent through systematic peer learning and self-assessment
tgt_text: Diphetho tša Kabinete.

src_text: Cabinet decisions.
tgt_text: Lefelo le le Kgethegilego la Ikonomi la Namakwa (SEZ).

src_text: Namakwa Special Economic Zone (SEZ).
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše go kgethwa ga SEZ ya Namakwa ka Aggeneys ka Kapa Leboa.

src_text: Cabinet approved the designation of the Namakwa SEZ in Aggeneys in the Northern Cape.
tgt_text: Kgetho ye šišintšwego dirwa go ya ka Molao wa Dilete tše di Kgethegilego tša Ikonomi, 2014 (Molao wa 16 wa 2014) le SEZ ye šišintšwego ke karolo ya Lesolo la Peeletšo ya Mopresidente.

src_text: The proposed designation is done in terms of the Special Economic Zones Act, 2014 (Act 16 of 2014) and the proposed SEZ is part of the Presidential Investment Drive.
